summary: This bill, HR 2351, directs the Commandant of the Coast Guard to update Coast Guard policy regarding medication to treat drug overdoses, specifically including naloxone for opioid and fentanyl overdoses. It mandates naloxone availability on all Coast Guard installations and in operational environments. The bill also requires participation in a tracking system related to substance abuse and a memorandum of understanding between the Coast Guard and the Department of Defense. Finally, it calls for a briefing to Congress on the use of these medications and opioids within the Coast Guard. It amends existing law regarding controlled substances on vessels.
